page.title: 10Warkton's tale, Kettering.
page.content: One day during the first world war a young mother and her baby were seen in Warkton. The mother called at a cottage and was given milk by the occupier who noticed that she seemed to be very distressed. Apparently her husband was fighting abroad and news from the front was not at all good. Later that day the child's body was found lying in a pool of blood in the church porch. With the porch defiled another entrance had to be used until the Bishop had reconsecrated it. A lady we met told us that when she was a child she could remember the black mark made by the blood. Nobody dared to step on it as they went in to Sunday School! This is a sad but true story.
